line_1: Be rul'd, and in thy friend confide;
line_2: Thy wandering mind, thy footsteps guide.

line_1: "Fear not, fair nymph, in me alone confide;
line_2: Confusion struck my frame, when Patience cry'd,

line_1: While some on Stores of venom'd Juice confide,
line_2: And in close Cells the noxious Treasures hide.

line_1: " Learn Wretch in meaner Cunning to confide.
line_2: "But since in changing Forms you vainly pride,

line_1: To whom I may my careless youth confide?
line_2: Once more to float on Dissipation's tide?

line_1: And say, to love I gold confide.
line_2: Are viewing me, a beauteous bride,
And be it so, true William cried;

line_1: And ere you venture to confide,
line_2: Let his preceptor's heart be try'd;

line_1: And on a Monarch's faith and pow'r confide.
line_2: Give it free air — lay chilling fears aside,

line_1: In whose tender bosom my soul may confide,
line_2: Whose kindness can sooth me, whose counsel can guide.

line_1: But let me in thy faith at least confide,
line_2: Which, ah! too well I know will all be tried,

line_1: No more in flatt'ring hope confide.
line_2: An Angel came. Ah friend, he cry'd,

line_1: In walking can no more confide
line_2: Than when on "wings of winds I ride."

line_1: If to frail Reason's Conduct we Confide
